description: This image is a joint work with my great friend and astrophotographer Maicon Germiniani. Maicon captured the data using his gear from SC, Brazil and provided the LRGB masters. I post-processed and assembled the data. Maicon's high quality data made my processing much more enjoyable. Thank you very much my friend "Next to one of the most famous sky nebulas in the southern hemisphere we can find this beautiful open cluster. I am struck by the fact that despite its beauty, it is rarely photographed. Very close to it, we have another famous object: Gabriela Mistral Nebula, just outside this image' lower left corner. This image has a special meaning, being a joint work with a great friend and astrophotographer that astrophotography brought me." Object description by Maicon Germiniani Capture and Pre-Processing by Maicon Germiniani Post-Processing by Gabriel Rodrigues Santos Telescope: Triplet 115/800 Camera: ZWO ASI 183MMPRO ZWO FILTER WHEEL 8x1.25 LRGB (210-60-60-60) Total: 6.5 Hours All frames in BIN 1x1 All frames 180 seconds Please check out Maicon Germiniani's Inspirational Gallery Thank you for taking your time to look at this image. I especially thank Maicon for sharing the great data - we had great conversations during the project.
title: Gem Cluster - NGC 3324 - Joint Work with Maicon Germiniani
